result.execSummary:
The defendant Hunter J Marks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 11/20/2015 @ 1:30pm

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $628.00 through agent. Cash bail applied.
Provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all remaining costs, surcharges and assessments during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may not vote until his/her civil rights are restored and he/she may never possess a firearm.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Obtain an AODA assessment and follow-up treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens. No illegal drugs.
- No Contact with victim. No other modificatin without the approval of the court.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
- Defendant to have a mental health evaluation and cooperate with any treatment.
- Defendant to participate in a parenting class.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Pay supervision fees.

cab
  The defendant is in absconder status.  The Court lifted the stay on the balance of the conditional time  30 DAYS and ordered a commitment to issue.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.

Defendant Hunter J Marks in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant was in absconder status but appeared today.  
  DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 5 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Case adjourned to 01/15/16 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 36.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Received and filed:
Justice Point report.
cab

Defendant Hunter J Marks in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. Received & Filed, Victim Impact Statement and Restitution Information. Discussion regarding Facebook posting, court admonished defendant to comply with terms of no contact order. Parties stipulate to restitution request. Plea Hearing proceeded.
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion from the state, the court ordered Count 1 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Defense counsel requests an adjournment for Sentencing. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Missed Office Contact.

Defendant Hunter J Marks in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. All conditions of bail remain in effect. State advised the court or victim's concerns (victim not present in court).  Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Hunter J Marks in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Pretrial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: SHERRY P.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.
